heading: Objective
body: Lock in trust and momentum after commitment by guiding the guest through next steps with clarity, celebration, and zero surprises—so they feel confident, cared for, and excited to take delivery.

heading: Why this matters
body: The ‘yes’ moment is a high-risk transition point. Confusion, tone shifts, or delays can trigger doubt and unwind the deal.

heading: What great looks like
body: A guest who feels celebrated, in control, safe from surprises, and confident about what happens next.

heading: YES PROTECTOR Framework
body: Confirm + celebrate → 3-step roadmap → time expectations → warm handoff → keep emotional temperature high.
notes: Put as a simple framework visual.

heading: Buyer’s remorse risk
body: Regret risk peaks after commitment. The brain seeks confirmation and reacts strongly to uncertainty.

heading: Uncertainty feels like risk
body: Small unknowns (time, steps, trade, finance) feel big unless you make the process predictable.

heading: Tone shift breaks trust
body: Warm → transactional creates the feeling ‘now they’ve got me.’ Keep tone consistent through handoffs.

heading: Cognitive load kills momentum
body: Too many details increases fatigue and impatience; simplify into one sentence per step.

heading: Confirm the yes cleanly
body: Remove ambiguity: restate vehicle choice and get a simple confirmation.

heading: 3-step roadmap
body: Always provide a predictable sequence immediately after yes.

heading: Time expectations
body: Set honest timing and promise updates every 10–15 minutes if waiting.

heading: Warm handoff
body: Introduce the next person with context and benefit; never ‘dump’ the guest.

heading: CRM notes capture
body: Record vehicle choice, trade notes, timing constraints, and sensitivities to prevent surprises.

heading: 3-step roadmap script
body: ‘Here’s what happens next—it’s simple: 1) confirm details 2) paperwork 3) delivery setup.’

heading: No surprises statement
body: ‘My goal is zero surprises. If anything changes, I’ll tell you right away and explain it clearly.’

heading: Warm handoff to finance
body: Reframe finance as support and predictability; use permission-based language.

heading: Role-play focus
body: Practice post-yes confirmation, roadmap delivery, warm handoffs, anxiety spikes, and waiting updates.

heading: Worksheet purpose
body: Reinforce clean confirmation, roadmap delivery, warm handoff language, and CRM notes discipline.
